Weddings + Special Events
From weddings to intimate gatherings Fox Hollow Golf Club is the perfect place for your event. With breathtaking views of the golf course and exceptional staff our ballroom/banquet room is sure to impress. Our staff will help with the planning process to make sure your event is both phenomenal and memorable. Our services include onsite wedding catering, bar services and vendor referrals. You can relax knowing our staff will handle many of your details while still offering you the DIY concept.
We look forward to hosting your next event!
Ceremony Site and Reception
Why not have your wedding and reception at the same place. We have a beautiful ceremony site situated just outside the banquet facility under the old oak tree with stunning views of the lake between the 10th and 18th holes. Inside the air conditioned banquet hall you will still have stunning views.
Wedding Packages
Customize your wedding for the perfect day. Call for a consultation with:
Kristen Ritz
Banquet and Restaurant Manager
Email:
banquets@foxhollowgolfclub.com
727-376-6333 ex: 3
727-484-6939 fax
Contact Our Special Events Coordinator
Kristen Ritz
Banquet and Restaurant Manager
Email:
banquets@foxhollowgolfclub.com
727-376-6333 ex: 3

Membership Rates
We have different membership types. For more information and pricing, please fill out the inquiry form below.
Junior Membership (Ages 21-27)
Intermediate Membership (Ages 28-34)
Full Membership (Ages 35 and up)
Privileges
Tee time reservations up to fourteen (14) days in advance.
$4.00 per individual bucket of practice balls.
*Family Membership includes spouse and children under 23, who live in your household.
Membership Benefits
Assessments/Minimum Spending
Members will NOT be liable for operating deficits, capital improvements, special assessments, or minimum spending.
Initiation Fees and Dues
Upon acceptance as a member of Fox Hollow Golf Club, the initiation fee plus dues for the appropriate billing period along with applicable taxes must be paid in full. Dues are billed semi-annually with payment due on April and October 1st. Non-resident members will be billed on October 1st and January 1st.
Member Golf Tournaments
View Tournament Schedule
Private Functions
The Clubhouse may be utilized on occasion for private functions provided they do not conflict with regular club activities. Such functions will be scheduled in advance with the food and beverage director and will be posted for the convenience of the general membership.
Locker-Rooms
Lockers are available on an annual basis and may be reserved and paid through the golf shop. Security of the locker’s contents is the responsibility of the member. Towels are provided for locker room use only.
Policies for Children
Children who are included in a family membership are subject to the following guidelines:
Play is upon professional staff approval
Play is at non-peak times
Children under 15 must be accompanied by an adult on the course, practice area, and the clubhouse
Children 15-22 may play unaccompanied and may book starting times only with professional staff approval
To request Membership Information at Fox Hollow, call 727-376-6333 or fill out the form below.
Membership is currently closed. To add your name to the waiting list please submit the form below:
Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form.

About Us
Fox Hollow Golf Club is one of the premier golf courses in the state and was recently rated 57th by Golf Digest’s Top 75 Courses Accessible to the Public in Florida. Purchased by the Creighton family in 2013, one of their goals was to take the course to a higher level by upgrading course conditions and constantly making improvements. Dave Creighton Sr. owned and operated several courses in Florida starting with Northdale Golf Club from 1980 to 2000. Other courses include Rosemont, Kissimmee, Celebration, Countryway, Lexington Oaks and now Fox Hollow. Dave Sr. had a 21-year professional hockey career including 11 seasons in the NHL with the Boston Bruins, Toronto Maple Leafs, Chicago Black Hawks and New York Rangers. Son Adam followed his dad’s path into professional hockey with a 14-year NHL career, including two years with the Tampa Bay Lightning (1992/93 and (1993/94).
Since the Creighton’s purchased Fox Hollow in 2013, they have continued to upgrade the course each year.  Because of this, the course and amenities have been taken to a higher level.
Opening in 1994, the Fox Hollow golf course has the distinction of being one of the last courses designed and built by Robert Trent Jones, Sr., one of the most prolific and innovative golf course designers of all time. In his design of Fox Hollow, the legendary Jones created a layout as picturesque as it is playable. Quite simply, Fox Hollow offers a good, fair test of golf.
The par-71 championship layout features five sets of tees and offers new challenges every time it’s played, mixing native trees and vegetation, sparkling lakes, sand bunkers and a variety of wildlife. Fox Hollow’s rolling fairways are a delightful departure from the pancake-flat layouts found elsewhere in Florida. The putting surfaces at Fox Hollow feature SeaDwarf Paspalum, a hearty turfgrass that can be irrigated with effluent, reclaimed, or even seawater. This grass also has the ability to deliver fast green speeds (9+ on the Stimpmeter) and requires less fertilizer, pesticide, weed control and irrigation. Arguably, Fox Hollow possesses some of the finest quality, most environmentally friendly green complexes in the Tampa Bay area.
Convenience and an emphasis on friendly, unobtrusive service also contribute to the Fox Hollow experience. From the time you drop off your clubs until you reach the first tee, everything you need is readily accessible. The 15,000 square foot clubhouse is the focal point, featuring a fully stocked pro shop, locker rooms, private meeting rooms and an upscale dining room to serve as an alternative to the more relaxed atmosphere of the “Grille at Fox Hollow Golf Club.” Both share spectacular views of the 10th and 18th holes of the golf course. If awards are what you’re looking for, the Tampa Tribune has placed Fox Hollow on its list of top three public-access courses in all of west central Florida; and Central Florida Magazine says the 18th hole, with its forced carry off the tee and water running the entire length of the hole on both sides of the fairway, is simply the “Best Par 4 in Florida”. Water comes into play on 11 holes and Jones’ other signature feature – plentiful, profound and penal bunker complexes – abounds. Fox Hollow has hosted local qualifying for the U.S. Open as well as qualifiers for the Valspar Championship, the PGA Tour event held annually at Innisbrook Golf Resort.
Events
The Fox Hollow clubhouse is available for tournaments, private parties, weddings, receptions and dinners, all catered by its professional events staff. The staff will help design the menu, handle the details and have the golf course in impeccable condition for your event. They handle tournament groups from 20 to 144 players. Competitive pricing is available. For more information, visit
FoxHollowGolfClub.com
or call (727) 376-6333.
Practice Facilities
As you exit the clubhouse, Fox Hollow’s practice facilities are all within easy walking distance. The practice facility consists of a grass driving range with over 25 hitting stations, a chipping green with a practice bunker, and a 10,800 square foot practice putting green. Lessons and clinics are available, taught by Fox Hollow’s highly experienced PGA & LPGA professional teaching staff.
Memberships
Three attractive golf membership packages are available: Junior, Intermediate and Regular. Both single and family memberships are available in all three categories. Regular and family members may book tee times up to fourteen days in advance.
Daily Fee Players Welcome
Fox Hollow is a semi-private club. Another initiative taken by the Creighton family is a significant reduction in the rate structure. Playing Fox Hollow has never been more affordable. Reserve tee times online at
FoxHollowGolfClub.com
or call the pro shop at (727) 376-6333.
